titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Culley was reported ill, & I celebrated in his stead at 8 a.m. There were but few communicants, including Olive & Christian. We had to do without the organ, as Ellis could not be recalled in time. The choir sang without accompaniment very well. Lord Guthrie & his wife were in church: they communicated (being Presbyterians) at the midday Celebration. They came in to tea after Evensong.

body.p: I wrote a signed article on Kikuyu from the point of view of a liberal Anglican.
